00214     //Following methods are called by the non virtual method get_position. Which of the four methods
00215     //is called is decided by the actual type of the given WorldObject type and by the question whether
00216     //the given RobotRef references on the calling robot.
00217     //Note: Return global coordinates here. They are automatically converted to local coordinates in
00218     //View::get_position method.
00219     //@see View::get_position
00220     //@see View::delegate_function
00221     virtual Vector3d get_own_position(const RobotData& robot) const;
00222     virtual Vector3d get_robot_position(const RobotData& robot) const;
00223     virtual Vector3d get_obstacle_position(const Obstacle& obstacle) const;
00224     virtual Vector3d get_marker_position(const WorldObject& marker) const;
00225 
00226     //Pretty much the same concept as in View::get_own_position besides this methods are called by
00227     //View::get_marker_information.

00229     virtual MarkerInformation get_robots_marker_information(const RobotData& robot) const;

00240     //Following two methods are called by get_robot_acceleration. If the given RobotRef is referencing the
00241     //calling Robot then get_own_acceleration is called, otherwise get_others_acceleration.
00242     virtual Vector3d get_own_acceleration(const RobotData& robot) const;
00243     virtual Vector3d get_others_acceleration(const RobotData& robot) const;

00292     //To do so it compares the Identifier of the resolved data object with the given Identifier pointerwise.
